result.execSummary:
The defendant ZACHARY T HENDRICKS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. ZACHARY T HENDRICKS is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • ZACHARY T HENDRICKS was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • ZACHARY T HENDRICKS was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to any other sentence.  Granted Huber, if in compliance with jail regulations.  Granted good time.  Credit for 3 days.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

Court costs to be paid within 60 days of sentencing, unless payment arrangements are approved.  Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts within 60 days. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay all fees and costs.
Follow all rules of department.
Counseling as deemed appropriate including COMPAS assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Provide DNA sample and fingerprint if not previously submitted. 
Early termination of probation, at agent's discretion, upon successful completion of conditions and no further law violations.
